Technical Repository Summary:

The markhazleton-blog is a sophisticated personal blog and portfolio website built using a modern static site generation architecture, leveraging PUG templates, Node.js build systems, and Azure Static Web Apps for deployment. The project implements a comprehensive, modular build system with specialized renderers for PUG, SCSS, JavaScript, and content generation, enabling automated RSS feed and sitemap creation while maintaining high standards for SEO and performance. Its unique architecture features a unified build script with granular control over compilation processes, supporting dual stylesheet compilation (legacy and modern CSS) and integrating Bootstrap 5 with custom SCSS customization. The repository demonstrates an advanced web development workflow with robust CI/CD integration via GitHub Actions, featuring nightly quick checks, monthly maintenance, and automated Azure deployment, making it an exemplary model of a modern, well-structured static website project targeting technical professionals interested in project management, web development, and technology solutions.

Key Technical Highlights:
- Static site generation with PUG 3.0.3
- Modular Node.js build system
- Azure Static Web Apps deployment
- Automated content generation (RSS, sitemap)
- Comprehensive SEO and performance optimization
- Advanced SCSS compilation strategy
